speaker: RADDATZ
text: Intravenous injections are given for quick rectification of hypocalcemia (low calcium) to prevent serious complication.

speaker: RADDATZ
text: Avoid phosphate-containing meals such as soda and other fizzy drinks because they draw calcium from your bones.

speaker: RADDATZ
text: Candidates can take up to a minute-and-a-half to respond directly to a question.

speaker: RADDATZ
text: Computer tomography or magnetic resonance imaging of the neck is performed to determine the presence of tumors or structural abnormalities close to the parathyroid gland.

speaker: RADDATZ
text: There are green, yellow, and red lights that each candidate will see to signal when time is running out and when they're supposed to be finished with their answers.

speaker: MUIR
text: an-made (synthetic) parathyroid hormone has been developed. However, it is not generally accessible and is presently undergoing long-term studies to determine its advantages and safety. .

speaker: CLINTON
text: Well, thank you.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And I'm delighted to be here in New Hampshire for this debate.

speaker: CLINTON
text: You know, the American president has to both keep our families safe and make the economy grow in a way that helps everyone, not just those at the top.

speaker: CLINTON
text: The condition is more common in people younger than 40 years of age.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I have a strategy to combat and defeat ISIS without getting us involved in another ground war, and I have plans to raise incomes and deal with a lot of the problems that keep families up at night.

speaker: CLINTON
text: I'm very clear that we have a distinct difference between those of us on this stage tonight and all of our Republican counterparts.

speaker: CLINTON
text: From my perspective, we have to prevent the Republicans from rolling back the progress that we've made.

speaker: CLINTON
text: They would repeal the Affordable Care Act, not improve it.

speaker: CLINTON
text: They would give more tax breaks to the super-wealthy and corporations, not to the middle class.

speaker: CLINTON
text: And they would, despite all their tough talk about terrorism, continue to let people who are on the no-fly list buy guns.

speaker: CLINTON
text: So we have a lot of work to do in this campaign to make it clear where we stand in the Democratic Party, what we will do for our country, and I look forward to this evening's discussion of real issues that face the American people.

speaker: CLINTON
text: Thank you.

speaker: RADDATZ
text: Sayre syndrome or MELAS syndrome, because these illnesses are linked with issues in addition to hypoparathyroidism.

speaker: SYSTEM
text: (APPLAUSE)

speaker: RADDATZ
text: Governor O'Malley?

speaker: O'MALLEY
text: Martha, thank you.

speaker: O'MALLEY
text: Tonight we have a different debate than the debates that we have been allowed to have so far, because tonight is different because of this reason, that in the course of this presidential campaign America has again been attacked by jihadi terrorists, American lives taken from us.

speaker: O'MALLEY
text: So, yes, we must talk about our ideas to move our economy forward, but the first job of the president of the United States is to protect the people of the United States.

speaker: O'MALLEY
text: I visited with a number of our neighbors in Northern Virginia at a mosque last Friday.

speaker: O'MALLEY
text: And as I looked out there at the eyes of our neighbors, I also looked in the eyes of veterans.

speaker: O'MALLEY
text: I looked into the eyes of Boy Scouts.

speaker: O'MALLEY
text: I looked into the eyes of moms and dads who would do anything in their power to protect our country's values and our freedoms.

speaker: O'MALLEY
text: What our nation needs right now is to realize that, while we face a terrible danger, we also face a different sort of political danger.

speaker: O'MALLEY
text: And that is the danger that democracies find themselves susceptible to when unscrupulous leaders try to turn us upon each other.

speaker: O'MALLEY
text: What our country needs right now is new leadership that will bring us together around the values that unite us and the freedoms that we share as Americans.

speaker: O'MALLEY
text: We will rise to challenge of ISIL and we will rise together to the challenges that we face in our economy.
